page.title: 03The Coast at Clevedon
page.content: As Clevedon is on the coast of the Bristol Channel,it is very often windy.Much of Clevedon is below sea level,which is why we sometimes get floods.In 1981,the water poured over the sea wall and flooded part of the town.The beaches are Clevedon Bay and Ladye Bay.They have pebbles and shingle.There are several cliff walks along the coast.From the cliffs near Ladye Bay,there are views of Wales across the Channel and lovely sunsets!At the top of the hill, by the golf course,there is Walton Castle.Two pop stars are thinking of buying it!I have found that in Clevedon,the people are more friendly than in Bristol(where I lived before), because people know each other. There are too many people in Bristol for that! by Kathryn Harris(age 11)
